Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class Repository.ValueIndex<Y>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.Repository.ValueIndex<Y>
Type Parameters:
Y - the indexed key type
Enclosing class:
Repository
public static class Repository.ValueIndex<Y> extends Object
Index for a given type.

Holds cached inversion indexes for a particular key type. The generic parameter Y is the type of the indexed key (for example an id or simple lookup value) returned by the functions used to build the index.

  • Constructor Details

    • ValueIndex

      public ValueIndex(Class<Y> indexType, Repository repo)
      Create a new ValueIndex for a given key type and repository.
      Parameters:
      indexType - the class of the indexed key type (for example Integer.class for an id)
      repo - the repository to use for looking up values when building the index

  • Method Details

    • cache

      public <X> void cache(Class<X> xCls, Repository.SerializableFunction<X,Y> fn)
      Cache an index for a given mapping function. This allows pre-populating the index for a function, which can be useful if you know you will be querying it multiple times and want to avoid the overhead of lazy population on first query.
      Type Parameters:
      X - the return type (the entity type being indexed)
      Parameters:
      xCls - the class of the return type X
      fn - must be expressed in the form `X::getY` for it to work properly as a key. If it is not then additional indexes will get created.

    • getType

      public Class<Y> getType()
      Get the class of the indexed key type for this index.
      Returns:
      the class of the indexed key type (for example Integer.class for an id)

    • lookup

      public <X> Set<X> lookup(Y indexed, Class<X> type, Repository.SerializableFunction<X,Y> fn)
      Lookup values of type X that link to a specific indexed key value of type Y, based on a mapping function that maps X to Y. This is a foreign key lookup equivalent and returns objects that link to a key. This will generate an index the first time it is called and thereafter use the index.
      Type Parameters:
      X - the return type (the entity type being looked up)
      Parameters:
      indexed - the value of the indexed key to lookup (for example an id)
      type - the class of the return type X
      fn - must be expressed in the form `X::getY` for it to work properly as a key. If it is not then additional indexes will get created.
      Returns:
      a set of values of type X whose `fn` methods return the indexed value
